title: Credential manager confcons upgrader
author: sparerd
body_snippet:
ConfCons files need to be updated for the rollout of the credential manager feature. ConfCons will no longer store user/domain/password data directly, but will store an ID of the credential record that does have that information.

Features to include:

- [ ] if the confcons file is below a certain version, the user should be be presented with a dialogue that allows:
   - [x] upgrade the currently targeted confcons file
      - [x] confcons files must now store an ID for the connection info...

iterations.description: Enhancement for credential manager confcons upgrader requires significant refactoring as noted by sparerd, and the last triage comment requested retesting on latest builds with reproducible steps — no response yet confirming this is still needed or providing updated requirements.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Loading a separate confcons file during upgrade will take a bit of refactoring. The current upgrade implementation hijacks the deserialization process (decorator). To open a new file we would need to somehow break out of the deserialization process and stop whatever other logic was supposed to run in order to restart the entire "load connection file" workflow with the new confcon file.
